SEARCH
Package org.marjoriekohn.diningreview.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
org.marjoriekohn.diningreview.controller.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/users") public class UserController extends Object
Manages RESTful API endpoints for User-related CRUD operations. The UserController class maps to the /users URI and provides endpoints for creating, reading, and updating users. It leverages the UserService class for business logic and data manipulation, thereby maintaining a clean separation of concerns. The endpoints are designed to return appropriate HTTP status codes and messages.
See Also:

  • UserDTO

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      @PostMapping("signup") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createUser(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserDTO userDTO)
      Registers a new user. This endpoint maps to a POST request at /users/signup and utilizes the UserService to register a new user. Errors that happen during the registration process are handled by the UserService.
      Parameters:
      userDTO - the Data Transfer Object containing user details, required
      Returns:
      a string indicating the result of the operation "User created successfully."
      See Also:
      • UserService.createUser(UserDTO)

    • findByUsername

      @GetMapping("/{username}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> findByUsername(@PathVariable String username)
      Retrieves user details based on username. This endpoint maps to a GET request at /users/{username} and utilizes the UserService to fetch the user's details. Errors that happen during the retrieval process are handled by the UserService.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to retrieve, required
      Returns:
      the user's details of the user with the specified username
      See Also:
      • UserService.findByUsername(String)

    • updateUser

      @PutMapping("/{username}/update") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateUser(@PathVariable String username, @RequestBody UserDTO userDTO)
      Updates an existing user's information. This endpoint maps to a PUT request at /users/{username}/update and uses the UserService to modify the user's details based on the provided UserDTO. Errors that happen during the update process are handled by the UserService.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to update, required
      userDTO - the Data Transfer Object containing the updated user details, required
      Returns:
      the result of the operation "User updated successfully."
      See Also:
      • UserService.updateUser(String, UserDTO)
